bug.author: jlewi
bug.summary: KfDef specs should use KfDef v1beta1
bug.description:
The KfDef specs stored here: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/tree/master/bootstrap/config>https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/tree/master/bootstrap/config</denchmark-link>
Should be updated to use KfDef.Spec.Applications. Support for KfDef.Spec.Applications should already be available in v0.6.0 Follow on to <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/issues/3491>#3491</denchmark-link>
0.7 configs should be updated to use KfDef v1beta1.

GCP configs are updated. I think Arrikto config will be updated by <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/pull/3904>#3904</denchmark-link> . <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Jeffwan>@Jeffwan</denchmark-link> Do you want to update the AWS configs?
Just see this issue. I will make corresponding change.
Is this done?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/richardsliu>@richardsliu</denchmark-link> no; kfctl doesn't support v1beta1 yet and the KFDef YAML files still need to be updated. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/blob/18a8882d1ae3b4fdae2d1d34f80005948a7566b7/kfdef/kfctl_gcp_iap.yaml#L2>https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/blob/18a8882d1ae3b4fdae2d1d34f80005948a7566b7/kfdef/kfctl_gcp_iap.yaml#L2</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/gabrielwen>@gabrielwen</denchmark-link> How far will you get with this this week? <denchmark-link:https://github.com/gabrielwen>@gabrielwen</denchmark-link> will be OOO next week so maybe someone else can help pick up remaining work next week?

so here we could use v1beta1 in kfctl:
kubeflow/bootstrap/pkg/apis/apps/kfdef/kfloader.go
Line 197 in 6a0fd60
func LoadKfDefFromURI(configFile string) (*kfdefv1beta1.KfDef, error) {
I just mentioned this to <denchmark-link:https://github.com/swiftdiaries>@swiftdiaries</denchmark-link> so he will use this function during . therefore other remaining work would be migrate v1alpha1 to v1beta1. I'll write a simple script to do this (basically use the function I mentioned above for transformation). I might need help for verification after this point. <denchmark-h:hr></denchmark-h>
update: sorry I just realized we still need to migrate all the codes that use v1alpha1 over to v1beta1 and this is probably the biggest part of Kfdef v1beta1 migration. I'll do it tomorrow first thing.

TODOS:
Adds KfConfig for internal implementations. Inject KfConfig into all kfapps. Update all kfapps to use KfConfig instead of KfDef. Remove KfDef from kfapps Convert all KfDef v1alpha1 into v1beta1.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/lluunn>@lluunn</denchmark-link> any update on this?

/assign <denchmark-link:https://github.com/gabrielwen>@gabrielwen</denchmark-link>
/assign <denchmark-link:https://github.com/lluunn>@lluunn</denchmark-link>

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/lluunn>@lluunn</denchmark-link> is updating gcp to use <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Jeffwan>@Jeffwan</denchmark-link> could you also do the same thing for AWS? starting at this point we should change to KfConfig:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/yanniszark>@yanniszark</denchmark-link> could you help on updating existing_arrikto for using ? it should start at this point and convert to :

I ran into an issue: kfdef has a method, WriteToConfigFile, that writes the updated kfdef back to disk (app.yaml). To support this method in kfconfig, we need to convert kfconfig to kfdef. But then there is a cycle import: converter --> kfconfig --> converter. Any suggestion? <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kunmingg>@kunmingg</denchmark-link> proposed we should try to avoid writing back kfdef.
discussed offline. We should move converter logic into kfconfig. kfconfig can read from kfdef, and write to kfdef.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/gabrielwen>@gabrielwen</denchmark-link> sure! Does GCP use KfConfig? I'm asking because I'd love to have a reference implementation to follow. Btw, why leave do we leave it up to the platform to convert the KfDef and don't just pass a KfConfig? In addition, I should point out something that occurred to me recently. Kubernetes' conversion makes a hypothesis that it's possible to convert from one version to any other in a lossless manner. This is not true for KfDef. eg a v1beta1 config with multiple plugins doesn't have a corresponding v1alpha1 KfDef.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/yanniszark>@yanniszark</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Jeffwan>@Jeffwan</denchmark-link> we are adding some missing fields/functions to KfConfig. It should be done today/tomorrow and after that we should only need an one line change. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/yanniszark>@yanniszark</denchmark-link> could you explain more about information loss? doesn't v1alpha1 KfDef also have a list of plugins?

@yanniszark could you explain more about information loss? doesn't v1alpha1 KfDef also have a list of plugins?
I thought Plugins was only part of the v1beta1 spec. Seems like I was mistaken. Was the field added to maintain backwards compatibility?
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/yanniszark>@yanniszark</denchmark-link> plugins were added in v1alpha1 prior to 0.6
Can we close this issue <denchmark-link:https://github.com/jlewi>@jlewi</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/gabrielwen>@gabrielwen</denchmark-link> or still work remaining>
it's still WIP.

Fixing minor bugs. Currently known bugs:
nil pointer reference in gcp.go when populating errors. ingress doesn't have backends set up.
After <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/pull/565>kubeflow/manifests#565</denchmark-link> I think we need to update the docs to point to 0.7.0 files

After kubeflow/manifests#565 I think we need to update the docs to point to 0.7.0 files
I've already updated the doc yesterday (GCP part). will update to the new commit hash, tho.

Looks like the docs might already be uptodate <denchmark-link:https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/aws/deploy/install-kubeflow/>https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/aws/deploy/install-kubeflow/</denchmark-link>
Is using <denchmark-code>export CONFIG_URI="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/manifests/v0.7-branch/kfdef/kfctl_aws_cognito.0.7.0.yaml " </denchmark-code>
GCP docs look good. Looks like the Arrikto docs aren't using the "0.7.0.yaml" file <denchmark-link:https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/started/k8s/kfctl-existing-arrikto/>https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/started/k8s/kfctl-existing-arrikto/</denchmark-link>

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/gabrielwen>@gabrielwen</denchmark-link> looks like <denchmark-link:https://github.com/sarahmaddox>@sarahmaddox</denchmark-link> filed <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/website/issues/1224>kubeflow/website#1224</denchmark-link> to track doc updates. Is there any additional work beyond docs or can we close this?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/jlewi>@jlewi</denchmark-link> I think we can close this - <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Jeffwan>@Jeffwan</denchmark-link> also verified that 0.7.0 works on AWS side.
/close

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/gabrielwen>@gabrielwen</denchmark-link> : Closing this issue.
In response to this:
